Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Mother-Daughter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bluize45
Reviews.Content: I treated my Mom (and myself) to two nights at the Rosewood Crescent Hotel in Dallas. Everything about the hotel was exquisite, from the beautiful lobby when you enter to the very elegant spa and restaurants on site. It was, of course, quite pricey but if you're going for something above and beyond this is the place. The staff was incredibly nice, courteous and very attentive. They answered all our questions with a friendly attitude and made wonderful suggestions for things to do during our stay. The room was perfect with one minor exception, a small coffee maker would have made a big difference. Otherwise, this was the perfect girls getaway!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Dallas..”
Reviews.Author: dminner1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with 5 star rooms,,, Nobu's bar was cool at night. The lobby bar is a bit warm during the day because of all windows but weather out side was nice enough to have a drink outside. The hotel also had a Lexus which drove us to dinner one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: Our experience was completely positive. There was nothing that I could change. We went to see the Dallas Mavericks play Sacramento one night and our son road the elevator and talked to Demarcus Cousins since Sacramento was also staying at the hotel. The conceirge staff recommended excellent local restaurants. They did not try to push us to use their restaurants. Sammy's BBQ for lunch was excellent as well as the breakfast recommendation. Their car service took us the Book Depository and picked us up. The location was very close to everything we visited. It was about a half mile from the hotel to the basketball game. We have walked that far when we park at a parking lot for a game

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel with fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Eezidozit
Reviews.Content: After a month long trip in the USA staying at hotels across the country, this hotel was the standout in quality of service. The facilities are great, the best gym I've ever used in a hotel, and the rooms are charming, elegant and comfortable. But, from the front of house to the gardeners outside every staff member we encountered, even in passing, had a genuine smile to give. We particularly appreciated Boris, who was incredibly helpful and an all round good guy. Thank you Rosewood Crescent Hotel for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on business, was overall pleased with accomodations, however this was not a 5 star visit. The room was clean, nicely appointed, very quiet, and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. Nobu (restaurant) located in the hotel was a nice plus. There is no early coffee service other than room service - there is a Starbucks nearby but did not open until 8:00am. Shower was equipped with a wonderful shower head, but it was a shower in a tub, so the shower experience was claustrophobic - outwardly curved shower rods would have been nice. Overall very nice but not stellar.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: KendallN
Reviews.Content: I am so upset to have to write this review as I am from Dallas and have always admired this hotel from afar. Unfortunately we picked this hotel to stay in the night of our wedding. Big mistake. We were married on a Saturday and this hotel was a ghost town. Not to mention all the amenities we were promised, free breakfast, possible upgrade, were not granted. Even when we showed up in a wedding gown and tux they could have cared less. Our room was decorated in beige and brown and the TV was the size of a computer monitor. The bathroom was small and our view was of an office building about 100 ft away. Multiple times we tried to remind the staff we were newlyweds and that our reservation included breakfast, etc. and it fell on deaf ears. It was honestly so depressing to arrive at this hotel after the biggest night our life and quite frankly the biggest waste of our money. Upon learning our reservation was not honored (a few days later), they compâ€™d our bill $30 for the breakfast, and said they would look into the matter. Naturally we have not heard from them since. I do not recommend this hotel at all as there are plenty of updated, fun, reasonable hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sttflygirl
Reviews.Content: Although my friends and I stayed there because we were attending a concert at the DSO and wanted to be close,we found this hotel was SPECIAL!!! It was kind of rainy and wet and we had forgotten our umbrellas and SURPRISE!! They had an umbrella in the closet in our room. Also for the guests they had plush robes and house slippers to wear. After checking into our hotel, I almost wanted to forgo the concert and just lounge around. I intend to stay here again in the future. The staff were very friendly, and we got a courtesy car to take us to the Concert Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Superior Staff!”
Reviews.Author: OKBTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Crescent and it was fantastic! From the moment I called to book the room to driving away the service i received from a extremely knowledgeable and friendly staff was exceptional. Tara at the front desk was very helpful and got the perfect room at a very fair price. I used the concierge for several things. I called ahead and spoke to Ashlee who helped me with some surprises for my lady friend. She was fantastic and everything went off without a hitch. the room was large and well appointed. the bed was super comfortable and the bedding was soft and comfortable as well. we had spa appointments and they were perfect. we were pampered and very relaxed when we left. The Crescent is a fantastic elegant hotel but the service and the staff are the true stars. I have stayed at many "five star" properties and the level of service and the attention to detail and competence of the staff is rivaled by none. Next time I am in Dallas I will definitely choose to stay at the Crescent again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: superbeya
Reviews.Content: The best: fab restaurant Nobu is inhouse. Means good diner + late drink and nice sleep. Large and classy hall. Helpful staff Large rooms and corridors, modern bathroom, fresh furniture, quiet ambiance (clearly not a place to party). Going there twice year, no need to look for another place. A good and fair stay for great value. Complimentary wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: SouthernCross99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, is very clean and has very friendly staff. The room service was especially memorable, as was the friendly sushi chef we had at Nobu (connected to the hotel lobby). The rooms were simple - clean and spacious, with very comfortable beds. It isn't the best choice if you're looking for intimate or charming as it is in an office complex, but is great for amenities. One strange thing is that the housekeeping staff arrived to clean the room at 8:30am, which seemed odd - we had to ask them to come back. Also, there were some administrative hiccups upon check-out, but it was nothing too serious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but......”
Reviews.Author: tlagyn
Reviews.Content: Every year, a large group of us stay at the Crescent Court for a week professional activities. This is my 5th year. The desk staff are friendly and efficient making checkin and checkout efficient. The rooms are spacious and the minibar fairly well stocked. The beds are VERY comfortable! It is within walking distance to a variety of great restaurants, regardless of your culinary tastes, including a Nobu Japanese restaurant off the lobby. I have never used their spa services. The hotel staff are quite attentive. However, I did get annoyed by the" turndown service", which was almost routinely around 8:30 or 9 pm. Now there are other high end hotels nearby (like the Ritz only a block away), which should increase the competition and improve the service. Don't expect "good views" form ANY of the rooms. You pretty much be looking out at the entrance drive and an office building on one side of the hotel or a small courtyard and a shopping building on the other side. Nothing scenic around it.

Reviews.Title: “Not an upscale spa”
Reviews.Author: travels630
Reviews.Content: I visited the Crescent spa last week for an afternoon of pampering. I was greeted at the entrance and was a given a tour of the spa - not too impressed. It was very bright and didn't seem cozy and warm like a spa should be. I used the whirlpool, but the room felt very run down. I then proceeded to my massage which though the massage itself ws great the atmosphere was horrible. The spa is underground which my massage room ws under valet - so every car that passed through you can hear the walls/door shake. It was very annoying and not pleasant. Even my massage therapist apologized many times for the noise. So if you want a relaxing experience at a spa - I don't recommment the Crescant.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed at the Crescent”
Reviews.Author: Amanda R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were robbed while staying at the hotel. In our room. 60,000 in wedding rings were stolen - one was my grandmother's, which is irreplaceable. The hotel could have cared less, even with police involvement. VERY disappointed and will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed the weekend before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Van M
Reviews.Content: Would do it again in a heartbeat. Right in the middle of all that was happening downtown and uptown. Great facility, location and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered visit at the Crescent!”
Reviews.Author: nrdKC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crescent for our son's wedding weekend. The Crescent was tops in every way! From the post rehearsal dinner party at Palomino's to the storybook reception to the comfy beds and beautiful rooms and the Christmas Decorations - I just can't say enough good things.

Reviews.Title: “Can do attitude with no results”
Reviews.Author: Islandtime1027
Reviews.Content: During the holiday season, the lobbyl is beautifully decorated. Check-in was easy for me this time but often rooms are not ready at check-in time. This has happened to me in the past and happened again this year with others in my party. The front desk is very nice and friendly. The rooms are very average in appearance. The bed and pillows are superb. The rooms do have a scent of perfume in them. The smell is like their spa. Animals are allowed in the hotel and ride the elevators with other guest. Coffee is served in the lobby before 6:30. However, the area is not well maintained and often cups are unavailable and at time coffee. The staff was not helpful in correcting this. This was not limited to one morning but 3/3 mornings I visited the area. I arrived by 6:15 all three mornings so this should not have been an issue. I had a special request and I do realize this cannot always be accommodated. However, I was told twice that my request would be accommodated with a very can do attitude by the front desk. Unfortunately, my request was not honored. I would not have had any issues if someone had simply called to say we are sorry we cannot accommodate this request. The work area is not ergonomically friendly but the number of outlets in the room was excellent. The housekeeping service was excellent. I often left a jacket on the bed or pens and papers around the room. Every day my room a very neat and sparkled when I returned. I am unsure how this hotel is a five star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / No Complimentary Items”
Reviews.Author: Land&Sea
Reviews.Content: The Rosewood in Uptown Dallas is a typical full service 5 star hotel, as such those on a budget should seek other hotels in the area. 5 star items: Checkin was fast and accurate, Room was clean and well appointed, Robes, Comfortable Bed, 7 Floors, Nice Lobby, Great Staff, Accurate room service /wake up call. 4 star items: Shower, Towels, Television, Work Area, Outside Air Access (Door) but no balcony. 3 star items: Iron and Ironing Board (Iron mount is attached to the board inconvenient), air conditioning. 2 star items: No Coffee Pot, No Refrigerator, No Microwave, No Complimentary Items such as Bottled Water, Newpaper, Breakfast 1 star items: Parking, Speeding Cars In Drop Off Area (speed bumps needed). Safe Travels Everyone! Land and Sea

Reviews.Title: “Keep Going Back”
Reviews.Author: rhch
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how this hotel keeps getting a top rating on Conte Nast Traveler, but it does. It's a gorgeous property conveniently located in Dallas. The staff is out of sight nice, prompt and courteous. I guess that's how? Unfortunately the place isn't being taken care of.... The carpets all look dirty and the woodwork in the hallways is beat up by the housekeepers and room service help. I've stayed there many times and have never had the air conditioner work quite right to keep the room cool. God, there's nothing worse than a humid day in Dallas and standing there sweating in your room because the a/c won't keep up. While I truly enjoy the ambience of the place, I think my next trip I'll try the Ritz just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE - only downside was a hot pool in summer”
Reviews.Author: kujessie
Reviews.Content: clean, and over the top service. we asked for something and they would take it to the next level. my only complaint is the pool in the summer is more of a hot tub because texas is hot and the pool isn't covered. we were allowed to have a friend's bridal shower/bachelorette party in a large suite with no objection and in fact they helped us make the party great. we brought in our own snacks, alcohol and rented a cot to sleep 7 people in one room making it reasonable for a great location! tons of great bars/restaurants around within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for Two NBA Teams.....”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: I'm in the breaking news business, so I had no idea when I woke one day a few springs ago that I'd end that night at the Crescent Hotel. That morning actually started in Jacksonville, FL (another random destination) and, after a brief stop in Orlando, my colleague and I were re-routed to Dallas. Our employer booked us at the Crescent because it had been the site of a fundraiser held by a certain NY governor who, shall we say, was caught paying for female companionship. His resignation was delivered that day, in fact, and we were instructed to find folks who may have remembered details from his fateful night in Texas (we had moderate success). Anyhow, we arrived at the Crescent knowing nothing other than it was obviously a high-end property....a fact confirmed as soon as we entered the lobby and we saw the Indiana Pacers check in. It was hard not to stare. Thing got even more amusing the next morning when we saw the Charlotte Bobcats check out (both were in town to play the Mavericks that week). The hotel was spectacular and one of my favorites. The building is beautiful, the lobby opulent, the staff friendly. My room wasn't overwhelmingly big, nor was it the most modern I've been in. But it was certainly comfortable and well-appointed. My colleague and I ate that night at the Capital Grille next door and "spectacular" was an understatement. The hotel is also well-situated for exploring Dallas' nightlife, which we sampled, and the city's top sights (no time for that this trip). It's about a mile or so from downtown, and there's plenty of shops/restaurants/bars within a short drive or walk. The only negatives are the price: it's not cheap to stay there, period, plus you are charged more than you'd like for internet and valet parking. But those are minor complaints. If I'm able to do so -- I don't quite have the salary of a NBA player or NY governor -- I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but don't face the parking lot”
Reviews.Author: ZLOfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is elegant and with the right discount, a pretty good value. I stayed one night for business. Had drinks in the lobby and room service. All were very good. The lobby is beautiful. The room was adequate, but it was all I need for one night. Two double beds--not queens which seemed lame. I had a room facing the entry where cars pull in and out. It wasn't terrible, but pretty loud both in the evening and early in the am. Just ask for a room facing the quiet courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special But Some Irritants!”
Reviews.Author: sajdrk
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've stayed at a hotel where housekeeping is so poorly scheduled. I had to call for my room to be cleaned at 4:30 p.m., after being out of my room all day, and again for turn down service at 9 p.m. because they, for some reason, did not do it. As to other features, I'm not sure this hotel is rated correctly. I didn't see anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen H
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this Hotel we were made to feel welcome! There was a welcome note at the front desk waiting for us, the staff were helpful and informative and the property itself just lovely. The decor in the Lobby area and the Conservatory is wonderful and we liked our room too. The location was great and within walking distance of several spots - dinner options are easy and close-by. If I had to change one thing it would be to upgrade the bath tub, when staying in such a luxurious hotel it would have been nice to soak in the tub! Also, access to the Internet (for someone travelling without a laptop) I felt should have been a complimentary service, they did have several computers which were easily accessible but I felt that this should be a service of the Hotel and not something we had to pay for. Every single staff member was polite and friendly and we will definitely come back for another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: trjonas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rosewood Crescent on a business trip recently. There were only two negatives, one of which was not the fault of the staff: the people in my room checked out late, delaying my room's readiness. While I waited, one of the staff offered me a complimentary drink, and the front desk staff ensured my bags were carried up to my room and waiting for me at no charge. My room was spotlessly clean, spacious, elegant, quiet, and had a very nice view. I was completely comfortable there, and especially appreciated the central location with a Starbucks on the grounds. When I checked out, the staff was again especially helpful, taking care of my bags, communicating with the shuttle driver when my meeting went late, and hailing a cab for me once I was able to get back to the hotel. The only other negative was the bathtub - not at all made for actually enjoying a bath, its back was little better than 90 degrees. Whoever ordered that originally should try relaxing in a warm bath while sitting ramrod straight! But this again was not the fault of the staff, who did their best to make my stay an impeccable and delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Special”
Reviews.Author: AussieTexBrit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a year ago for our wedding night, and wanted to return to relive the magic of that night - and we couldn't have been happier. The staff were ever helpful, and we stayed in the room across from the room we had a year ago and it hasn't lost any of it's magic - my wife loved the many balconies the room offers. The bathroom is special, and we had so much room we would stay for longer if we could! We tried the spa on-site, and weren't disappointed. All the staff, like their hotel counterparts, were attentive, friendly and couldn't have been nicer. All-in-all, the Rosewood did not let us down and we plan on returning for many more anniversaries to come!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet respite”
Reviews.Author: fancyn
Reviews.Content: Overall, a pleasant experience. Love the Grohe shower head and huge towels. Loads of hot water. Room service was spot on. My spa experience was excellent. Turndown the first night was terrific; not so the second night. Room was a bit small for two people. Valets could have been more attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: NJ008
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in August 2011. The size and decor of room was fine, however the bathroom was average. The bathroom robes had hair on them. Room service messed up the orders three times. The front desk did waive the charges for one breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: brian12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on a business trip in June. I travel often and this is one of the nicer hotels I have stayed in. The rooms are spacious and the beds comfortable. Nobu is in the hotel and amazing! The restaurant for breakfast is also really nice. The gym/spa are second to none. I don't have any negatives to report. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is my most favorite hotel in the US”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a unique boutique experience with the speed, selection and style of a major facility. The staff and location are the obvious highlights. The rooms are very comfortable and the bathroom products are second to none. The spa and workout area is as good as you'll get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, attentive staff and great spa.”
Reviews.Author: Singerred
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights. Our room was spacious and well-appointed with a desk, refrigerator and make up area. The staff were friendly and attentive. The fitness area and spa are excellent with a lot of cardio equipment. The only negative was that there was a lot of noise in the hall from other guests, presumably staying in the hotel for one of the weddings which was taking place.

Reviews.Title: “Aging in place...”
Reviews.Author: Cleyera
Reviews.Content: We accompanied my husband on a business trip and stayed at Rosewood's Crescent Hotel. I remember staying here a decade or more ago on business myself and being quite impressed. These days, though, the hotel is showing its age and some neglect. For example, the dust ruffles on the beds in our rooms didn't touch the floor and were uneven. This seems like such a minor issue, but for a Rosewood??? They can do better. Ditto for the holes in the curtain sheers. I'm just so tired of staying at places who rest their laurels on their very best properties (like the Rosewood Mayakoba, which is breathtaking and perfect in just about every way!) while letting others decline. I just feel like we pay too much for that. The one very impressive and redeeming quality about Rosewood Crescent is the valet staff. They are all so professional, friendly and efficient--great representatives of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasLady7509
Reviews.Content: The Crescent is a lovely hotel near downtown and is my top pick for Dallas business trips. There's really nothing extraordinary about the hotel, but the service is top notch, the rooms are nice, and the sheets are FANTASTIC. It's walking distance from a ton of restaurants and bars. Nobu (the restaurant in the lobby), in my opinion, is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: NELANDO
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was OK at best. The room was clean but the entire hotel is just old. This would all be fine if the "staff" hotel employees didn't use it as their own private place to party. We (4 of us) went down to the pool and the there was no where to sit because the place was over taken by the hotel staff. Mind you this was a HOLIDAY weekend. Finally, the staff was nice enough to retire to their rooms so the actual guests could use the amenities they paid for. The actual pool was dirty and I got a piece of thin metal stuck in my foot. The bottom of the pool is so uneven our feet all feel like they lost a couple of layers of skin. At the lobby bar the waiter wanted to know what we were going to do and wanted us to join him and his friends. Very unprofessional since we didn't ask him and we just wanted a drink. The only thing good about this hotel is the location. We were able to walk to bars that are just down the street. However, to pay this much money and end up hanging out with the hotel staff in an ugly pool - will just go somewhere else next time. Crescent - you lost 4 guest forever.

Reviews.Title: “Its a very nice hotel, but not our style.”
Reviews.Author: mhoonbaker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice with lots of upscale shopping and reastruants. Not a place for a family trying to teach children the value of a dollar. It was very clean and the staff was very helpful and kind. Boris knew all our names and was awesome with the kids. The concerige desk always had helpful directions for the places we wanted to go, even if they had never been there themselvs. I would ask for a room facing the pool side, it will keep the traffic noise down. I liked the 3rd floor better than the 4 th floor - just seemed a bit nicer, can't put finger on it - just my impression. Let me warn you now, the 225$ room is just that, a room like any other hotel, yes the sheets were of a very nice qualty but nothing made it feel like a 225$ room - also the wifi is 10$ and it was AWFUL! very slow - this was a working vacation for the family and it was very frustrating. Parking is a pain and self park is still 9$ a day. I would suggest going ahead and using the valet service. Its Dallas Tx and the pool is outside, and heated. So it wasn't so much refreshing as much as like old bath water. The pool texture cut the bottom of my toes to pieces. Kids loved it, guess I was just a stick in the mud but I didn't enjoy it. I found public transportaton just outside the hotel on Pearl. A trolly stop and a bus stop. Trolly is free and took us to more affordable dining and a grocery story :) yes I carried groceries into the swanky hotel because I wouldn't let my kids take the $4.50 kit kat bar out of the very full mini bar and snack draw provided in the room. overall I think I would have enjoyed my trip more if I hadn't been in sticker shock over the little things that over complicated what should have been the simple luxury of vacation. I would reccomend this hotel to people who need everything done for them and have the $ to not flinch at it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Really loved it.”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly beautiful. The rooms are lovely, well appointed and posh. This is a bathrobe/slippers/high end amenities kind of place and the room does not disappoint. It's tasteful and elegant. The beds are super comfy. There is a wonderful vanity area separate from the bathroom with seating for makeup application. The shower head is a high end double headed sort of thing. One of my colleagues wasn't a fan, but I thought it was super cool and loved it. Most folks raved about it. The gym/spa is everything you would expect. Great variety of equipment and plenty of it. It is replete with those little extras of a truly luxurious hotel such as chilled water with a slice of fruit, attendants waiting to clean your machine, etc. I took advantage of the spa and loved the treatment. The relaxation room wasn't particularly special, but the massage was fabulous. This hotel is definitely in the league with the Four Seasons/Ritz.. Gracious hospitality in an inspiring setting.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: tvmed41
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a spa date and night at The Crescent for our anniversary. The spa experience was heavenly! Everyone was so polite and professional. I've been to different spa's in Dallas and this one is my new favorite! I highly recommend it. The overall experience at the hotel was great until about 10:30 p.m. We were awakened throughout the night by loud guests, car alarms, band in the parking lot around 1:00 a.m., wedding send off. I realize the hotel cannot control people and car alarms. It was just disappointing to not be able to relax and sleep throughout the night. After being awoken again at 2:45 a.m., my husband called the front desk. Not very responsive. He spoke to the manager the next morning, who comped the room. Overall, if you're looking for a great location and like to party and stay out late, this is the place. For a quiet, relaxing, recharging get away, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper thinâ€¦so itâ€™s great if you love to wake up early and listen to your neighbors talk about eyebrows or be k”
Reviews.Author: 2plus2and1
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks great. BUT...walls are so thin. You will hear everything! When promised to have your room changed you can be assured that no employee will look you in the eye again. This might not be all rooms. Spa was nice and the employees treated my family great in the spa. The hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gordon112233
Reviews.Content: The gym is excellent. The spa is excellent. Good food options within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saj5771
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents for a long weekend recently. I had seen the hotel on a previous business trip whole shopping at Stanley Korshak and thought I would give it a try. The hotel exceeded my expectations. The rooms were great- beds were super comfortable, but the service is really what made the experience so great. Everyone who worked there was friendly and great at their jobs. The hotel branded water bottles were a nice touch and housekeeping was generous with them. My parents had an issue with their door not opening and maintenance came within minutes of their call to the front desk. I would not want to stay anywhere else in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing time I have had in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: MK082956
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I spent the night in at The Crescent a few days before Christmas as a girl's treat. We each had a spa package that included several services as well as lunch. I can honestly say that this was the best place I have ever stayed. From the moment we walked in the front door to check in till we checked out we were given superior service in our rooms as well as the spa. Our room was absolutely beautiful and our day at the spa was unforgetable! We plan to make this an annual event! Thanks for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but ...”
Reviews.Author: rhch
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times. The front desk is helpful, attentive and ready to handle anything. The elevators can be a bit slow. Once in your room, it's nicely appointed with a bed that I personally love! I do have to admit for a Rosewood Hotel I was really disappointed at the worn, dirty carpet in my room. Some of the wood work in the hallways is pretty beat up by the housekeepers/room service folks. The maids take good care of cleaning up and are timely. They've added coffee pots which never used to be there to the rooms. Now, if they'd just leave coffee for them? I'd be happy to stay there again, just hope to see the rooms updated with new flooring.

Reviews.Title: “Our backs are still hurting”
Reviews.Author: avemariae
Reviews.Content: Everything about this property was excellent except for our soft pillow top bed. Far toooo soft for a good night's sleep. My husband and I are used to firm, high quality mattresses without pillow tops. Firm mattresses are recommend by all orthopedic doctors for best night's sleep. European hotels have great firm beds, why in the U.S. do all top hotels have terrible soft beds? Why can't the U.S. hotels offer some rooms with high quality firm beds? Is that a terribly difficult task, to have a few high quality firm beds for those who request them? When I made our reservations direct with Crescent Dallas hotel, the res. desk didn't know if beds were firm or soft, so she put me on hold and asked housekeeping for their opinion. Res. desk then told me beds were not pillow top and were firm new mattresses, so I booked the Metropolitan Suite. We requested a bed board and it was already in place when we arrived, but board did not make any difference, the bed was excruciatingly too soft. At 3 a.m., we were still unable to fall asleep due to this soft new mattress and our very sore backs. We phoned room service and asked for plain yogurt so that we could take some Advil to mask the back pain and allow us get some sleep. I sounded very tired on the phone, the room service gal felt sorry for us and had room service actually run up within 5 minutes with the yogurt. We fell asleep finally before our wake up call at 7:00. We were exhausted all day in our busy schedule and I hope we don't get sick from this stressful lack of sleep. Our Metropolitan Suite was lovely and came with free full breakfast ensuite. Otherwise, except for soft new mattresses, everything at this hotel is exceptionally good, everything very clean, attentive & cheerful staff, delicious food, well maintained hotel and facilitis, best location possible, professional staff, excellent housekeeping. The bed linens were lovely, douvet and pillows were 100% down and lovely. No complaints anywhere else except the most important of all - the too soft bed! The bed can ruin the entire stay! Pls, dear lovely hotel, have some firm high quality mattresses to offer your guests - not all backs are the same!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing-Better as a memory.”
Reviews.Author: cttwolakes
Reviews.Content: Our family chose this hotel because we had stayed here before. It was better as a memory. Although the staff is welcoming and helpful the hotel itself is in much need of an over haul. Upon arrival the first thing you see at the check in counter is the unsightly ceiling damage due to perhaps a water leak. The musty oder in the hallways will overwhelm you. Our first night we stayed on the second floor with a view the roof with a giant AC/generator unit which resulted in no sleep. The room was small~ very tight with two adults with one child. The carpeting had many nasty stains. My daughter wrote her name in the dust on the desk. The entire room was dusty especially the baseboards they were thick with dust. The toilet would not flush & the tub would not drain. The sink bowl was chipped in several places and had someone else's hair in it. The fixtures in the bathroom were rusted. The light fixture broken and hanging off of the wall. All that to then wake up to no coffee pot! They brought one up with ONE Folders coffee packet. The next day we asked to be moved. I specifically asked for an upgrade and would have been happy to pay whatever cost. We were moved to another room on the 5th floor exactly like the one we were in! Although it had a better view still the toilet didn't flush, the shower was moldy and the carpet was filthy. Our room accomodations made for a quite unpleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Such authentic, kind service!”
Reviews.Author: thebestlaidplans
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the level of kindness I was shown during my recent stay at the Crescent. I traveled with a very young child (under 2) and was solo mommying which can be very difficult when traveling. The staff was so helpful, from the valets to the front desk to the sitter they arranged for me to use. But what was especially notable for me was that the service did not feel gratuitous or robotic, but genuine and just plain gracious. Everywhere I turned, I saw staff relating to their guests, using their names, remembering details of their stay. It was such a unique experience. I didn't want to leave! I have stayed at other Rosewood resorts and will say that my room seemed a bit more aged than I expected. But it was well-stocked, exceptionally clean, and had everything in it I needed and more. There were even two weddings there during my stay, but the big events did not impact my comfort at all. The hotel is remarkably quiet. When I arrived, the crib I requested was waiting in my room. It was all made up and they even added sweet little gifts for my baby. Such a nice extra touch. I hope that my travels take me to the Crescent again.

Reviews.Title: “top 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: surferbali
Reviews.Content: very pretty hotel, with best staff service I had in the entire USA. friendly, attentive,helpfull, professional. well designed rooms and bathrooms. recommendable with no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeyp626
Reviews.Content: Had a meeting in Dallas so just stayed for a night. The hotel is beautiful and clean, nothing really unique about it, but does the job. I'd say a standard 4-star hotel. The lobby is nice and the hotel itself is very big. We went to the restaurant connected to the lobby for drinks and it was expensive but also quite fancy. The restaurant itself was very trendy. I was pleased with my stay overall. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and spa. Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: suzkid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent the weekend at the Crescent in Dallas for our anniversary. The staff was incredible. Very friendly, and everyone we met remembered our names during our two night stay. At one point, I asked the valet to get me a cab, and instead, he had the hotel's chauffeured Lexus take us to a great local restaurant. We had a place in mind, bu the driver recommended another place, and it was just as he described. We had a great experience. We had room service. Right on time and delicious. We also ate at the Conservatory and Nobu; both in the hotel. Both were very good. The spa was great, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: T_J_B_LR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I we stayed at the Crescent to celebrate our 5th anniversary and it was great. From the the time we showed up in the room (small dessert and card for the occasion were waiting) until leaving, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Located in the middle of uptown it was a great location to a lot of local hot spots including the rattlesnake bar at the Ritz and the Dragonfly at Hotel ZaZa. One example of the service was that we celebrated our anniversary with dinner at a restaurant offsite, but forgot to get a menu, we told the concierge and they had it for us and delivered it to the room the following day. The room was spacious and the bed and linens were very comfortable. The room included a flat screen TV, double head shower and was very quiet. Only thing is that you can see a little paint pealing in the bathroom, but certainly it was not a problem. Possibly the best part though was the spa, it was awesome, definitely would recommend and friends in Dallas say it is considered one of the if not the best by locals. We did get a great deal on the hotel as they were running a stay two nights get one free speacial, so it is tough to comment on what normal rates would be, but for this weekend it was a great deal all the way around and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service As Usual”
Reviews.Author: KP&TP
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crescent Court hotel several times and overall really enjoy the experience. Some of the rooms are really great, but I will review the room from my last stay, in Room 522: King Size comfortable bed with great linens and pillows. Nice flat screen TV and spacious room area, but would have loved to have a coffee maker in the room so I could heat water for tea in the evenings. Bathroom is large and very nice except that water pressure for the shower could be better. The Lady Primrose bath products are ok, not my favorites but nice large sized bottles at least. Loved the dressing/makeup area with cushioned bench, if I could purchase that and take it home I would, the lighting is really perfect and it's nicely designed. Room service was excellent food at an incredibly inflated price. Seriously, crazy expensive, more than I am used to at other high end hotels. Luckily, there is a Starbucks downstairs and an Au Bon Pain across the way in the 200 building, plus many great restaurants nearby for lunch/dinners. Speaking of restaurants, if you love seafood, give Trulucks a try, it's right across the street, excellent martinis and food. Definitely my favorite meal of the trip! Love the gym at this hotel, and love it even more now that there is not a daily fee to use it - lol. Lots of machines, both cardio and strength training and it is always clean. Service level is high at this hotel, from the friendly and helpful front desk and concierge to the maids, everyone is courteous and friendly. While this is not my absolute favorite hotel, I would recommend it to friends......

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but over-priced and needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: kuseler
Reviews.Content: With a weekend package, looked forward to a pleasant stay in Dallas at a nice Hotel: 1 - Package included valet, but the valets recommended 'self-park'...strange. 2- Initial room was next to an elevator shaft and a service room, so very noisy; but Hotel staff did move rooms and was responsive and caring with assistance here. 3- The Spa is not World Class, standard American style, nothing special. 4- The weekend packages that include breakfasts have an unwritten limit on your breakfast, 22 dollars per person; and with a tea and juice, you are almost there! I think the package rate descriptions are deceiving when the breakfast is limited to what equates to a light continental breakfast. 5- The rooms themselves are adequate and clean. Summary. Doubt the Hotel is more than 3-stars by European standards; needs renovation of bathrooms and facilities, the building just looks worn and tired. The places is over-priced, recommend staying elsewhere and recommend the Hotel really look hard itself if it intends to survive â€“ it is not competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Cotton Bowl Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: MollySanAntonio
Reviews.Content: Booking was easy by phone and she described the rooms perfectly. Originally were going to have 4 guests in one room but ended up with 3. Checked in early & room not ready so they upgraded up to a 900 square foot suite w/ FOUR balconies. We were going to grab a cocktail and wait with friends but they offered us the instant upgrade !! Huge king size bed w/ 2 closets , makeup vanity and huge master bath. Lady Primrose bath products were a relaxing touch. 2 bathrooms and full bar w/ fruit and cheeze plates. Room service portions are almost too massive but, they arrive fast. There were hand written notes delivered from the manager and daily temp. & info notes each morning. Downstairs I found Nobu was a hip and fun spot. The courtesy Mercedez were a nice touch and readily available. Spa has dated showers but nice hot baths w/ relaxing waterfall. I am in love with Rosewood Crescent and am looking into one of their resorts in Cabo for the summer. So glad we stayed here !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but customer service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: berrymedic20
Reviews.Content: The Rosewood Crescent is an impressive sight... The building is huge, and has a secluded plaza on Cresecent Court that is both cozy and elegant. When arriving, the place is clearly top notch. The lobby is beautiful, and nicely adorned with Christmas decorations (including a big tree, and a huge gingerbread house that was nothing if not impressive). It is clean, updated, and comfortable. Our room was big, the bed comfortable, and all of the details taken care of to a "T". We had a nice flat screen TV, full wet bar, and other amenities expected of such a high end hoteI. THe gym and spa are also ample and pristine, and the pool looked nice, but we did not use it as it is outdoors. The only thing we weren't keen on was the elevator bank, which only had 2 elevators that didn't work too quickly... but not a huge deal. The high caliber physical attributes of this hotel made us all the more surprised at the subpar customer service and general friendliness. Our first impression was not a good one. Although we arrived on schedule at about 2:30pm, we were told (rather bluntly, and in an unfriendly manner) that our room was not ready due to cleaning, and to check back in 25 minutes. To make up for it, the check-in guy phoned in a comp for some free Starbuck's coffee next door - which we appreciated. We were less comforted by the coffee, however, when two HOURS later, we still did not have our room. This was not amusing. If it had been an isolated incident I would let it go, but as this was a family wedding, we had the chance to hear the stories from numerous other guests. Shockingly, most of us had surprising wait times to get checked into our rooms (ranging from half an hour to more than 2 hours). The reason was always "cleaning." Not acceptable for such a place. The valet service was quick, but the staff also generally unfriendly. No service with a smile there. We also had a lost item in the banquet hall where the reception had been held. We called to see if the staff could retrieve it, and they said it was gone... Of course, no one had actually looked, because we later found it just where she had left it. F for effort. Lastly, the maid service was overdone. It seemed like every time we got back to our room, someone had rearranged everything... including all of our clothes and personal belongings. This was unnecessary, and a burden, as we kept needing to sort through it all to our clothes. Unnecessary, and perhaps if they spent less time mettling with our stuff and instead focused on preparing rooms for guests, people could get checked in faster. Just a thought. In summary, the place was great, but for the price and for an individual, find another nice hotel in Dallas that has friendlier more helpful staff. For large events, this might be the place to go regardless, as it's quite elegant and impressive, and HUGE!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Crescent Hotel. The hotel is lovely and the location is fabulous. The lobby is beautiful, very clean outdoor pool area, and nice grounds overall. Check in was quick and smooth and our deluxe room was large and very clean. Very comfy beds and nice quiet rooms. We had the continental breakfast delivered to our room and it was fine. Great shopping right outside the hotel and neighboring hotels are within walking distance for those in need of a night cap and change of scenery!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Crescent Court in Dallas. It is a bit pricey for Dallas ($350 the night I stayed), but worth it. It is located on the edge of the central business district and adjacent to an entertainment and restaurant corridor. Despite being so close to several busy streets, there is absolutely no street noise whatsoever. The interior is understated but decidedly upscale and elegant. Not flashy, but more "old money," like many of its clientele. Service is personal and first rate, as would be expected of a property of this caliber. Upon entering my room, I found a hand written note from the manager, plus a chocolate cowboy boot filled with candied pecans from the hotel kitchens. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and convenient”
Reviews.Author: maddeline
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during a business trip.This hotel is very comfortable-the rooms are spacious, the pool area is serene and the complex that the hotel is great- with great shops, Nobu and starbucks. I also loved the gym and spa. My one complaint is that I didn't think the staff , especially the concierge, was very helpful or friendly..

Reviews.Title: “Really very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: sleepyandgrumpy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in February 2008 as had meetings in the Crescent Court office complex. Started well by having my car whisked away without fuss as I pulled up, and then being upgraded to a suite. The rooms are very well finished, and the everything was very comfortable. My only gripes are the lack of wireless internet in rooms and the fact that my early morning breakfast went AWOL (they rushed up a fresh order, but still charged for it despite being an hour late). Nevertheless, everything else was very good. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: millim1900
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, great rooms and OK location make this hotel a very good place to stay. However, the poor restaurant staff, arctic air conditioning temperatures and hectic party scene detract from the hotel. In all, this reviewer mildly recommends staying at the Rosewood Crescent Court. First the problems: - the restaurant was beautiful, yet the staff seemed so distressed I actually was worried about one waiter's health. He was sweating all over the place (including in the food), clearly was on the verge of a nervous break down and was literally so ill that he poured coffee all over my mother-in-law and hardly could muster an apology. - for some reason, the hotel management decided high fifties is a reasonable temperature to set the A/C on. Bring a sweater, this place is freezing! - we had to contend with two booze powered reception/weddings with just hundreds of people wandering and stumbling around. All over the place, the hotel lost control of the party goers and it really detracted from the quality of the stay for the guests. The positives: - the staff was very cordial and nice throughout our stay. - the rooms were beautiful, well maintained and clean. - the location of the hotel was OK, but having seen Dallas now I know that a great location doesn't really exist. Despite the challenges we had during our stay, the positives outweighed the negatives, therefore this reviewer mildly recommends staying at the Rosewood Crescent Court.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelledNY
Reviews.Content: I've never been to Dallas, so I didn't know what to expect. I joined a friend of mine on this trip to visit her relatives, and we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed at Hotel Crescent Court which is a beautiful hotel with an equally fabulous spa. The hotel is located in what they call Uptown, a bit different from NY's version of Uptown, but it was nice nonetheless. My girlfriend and I ate at Nobu, which was relatively easy to get into, considering the NY Nobu's are much harder. Some great shopping at a store called The Shak, though crazy expensive. The spa was great....staff were sooooo nice and the massage I got was awesome. Our room was spacious and comfortable....cool dual head showerhead!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvl2day
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had wonderful stay - staff were at their best as always. The food was excellent. We enjoyed ourselves at the SPA and Fitness Center. You will not be disppointed!! Satisfied traveller!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Has Gone Downhill”
Reviews.Author: investr
Reviews.Content: My one night stay in a suite summarized as follows: PROS: 1) staff very helpful as they have been during every stay I can remember. 2) front-desk manager did deduct $200 from my room charge because of problems I encountered the first night. CONS: 1) room temp 65 degrees when I arrived. 2) living room phone had so much static that it was unusable. 3) complained to front desk about problems 1&2 after I arrived, and then was unhappy to find that when I returned 7 hours later, neither had been fixed. 4) service crew returned and finally fixed the thermostat issue. 5) the phone problem was not corrected during my stay. 6) next morning tried to use the coffee maker and found previous user's coffee grounds pouch still it it, and the beaker had not been washed - YUK!!!. 7) the room has large door windows that let in significant noise from the motorcourt below. 8) I called Rosewood Hotels office to complain about this problems, but the manager never returned my call. CONCLUSIONS: Have stayed here many times since the hotel was first built. This was my worst visit so far and the hotel appears to be in decline. I do not plan to return, especially since the Mansion and the Four Seasons Las Colinas provide outstanding alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but could use updating!”
Reviews.Author: Libguppy
Reviews.Content: We went back to the Crescent for our 5th anniversary. I was excited because I couldn't remember even what the room looked like from the first time. At the time, this was the first luxury hotel I had stayed in and I have been spoiled ever since. Now seeing it again, it's beautiful and classic, but it needs some updating. We wanted our original suite (458), but a party had booked it. OK, my husband got us in for the suite next door. So we arrive and whoever this party was had taken that one too! They had us in another suite on the second floor, except it wasn't going to be ready for 45 minutes! And this was at 3:30 pm which is well into check in time. Don at the desk was cool though and got us into yet another suite immediately. He said something at the time that it was going to be on the outside instead of facing the interior courtyard and asked if that would be a problem. I understand now why this was a concern. It was a great corner suite, but the insulation is so bad and we had so many French doors, we heard every single car, truck, motorcycle and plane that went by! One set of doors banged every time the wind blew. Room 400 was quite noisy. Also, the bathrooms need bigger tubs and the beds could be more comfortable. The linens and duvets were nice, but the mattress was too hard for my taste. The management very kindly sent us a dessert for our anniversary which was very cool! The staff were all very friendly giving greetings and asking if we needed assistance. I'll write another review for our dinner in the Crescent Club (fabulous!), but for this forum...it was a great experience and we enjoyed ourselves a lot! All in all, we loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tarajackson83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married June 10th, 2006 and we initially spent our honeymoon at Aventura Spa Palace. BUT our first night before we left that monday we spent in Dallas at the Hotel Crescent Court. Oh my gosh! This hotel is number one in everything; style, class, elegance, service, ambiance! We were greeted among arrival and our cute little Ford Ranger felt out of place amongst the Mercedes, BMWs, Hummers, Bentley's and Porsche's. Anyway, my husband had kept this night a surprise for me. He booked a honeymoon package and when we checked in, we were congratulated and immediately upgraded over $200 to the "Metropolitan Suite". When we got to our room with the bellman he opened the door and we were standing in a 2 story suite with a spiral staircase a bathroom downstairs and a full bathroom and loft-style bedroom upstairs. We also had a french door balcony that looked over the pool and courtyard. A few minutes later we recieved a cart with freshly chilled champagne, a mini wedding cake with white fondant icing and gooey chocolate inside, fresh flower, and a note from our GM that night. Also in our package was a 3 course meal to be either served at the restaurant or in our room, and breakfast. It was incredible! One of the events that made the night complete was seeing Shaquille O'Neal and the rest of the Miami Heat walk through our lobby! YES, the Miami Heat was staying in our hotel and about to leave for the second game in the NBA finals!! That was awesome! Please stay in this hotel and enjoy it like we did. We actually could have stayed here for our whole honeymoon and that would have been fine!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business - Look out for Celebs!”
Reviews.Author: JBond214
Reviews.Content: The Crescent Court is a luxury hotel close to the Amercian Airlines arena in Dallas. I've stayed here many times for business and seen a lot of famous people. Most recently saw the Miami Heat basketball team including Shaq! The hotel is very nice, rooms are not very large, but are very comfortable. The bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever stayed in. I highly recommend the Crescent. If you are looking for something a little more "trendy" I also recommend Hotel ZaZa (across the street).

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to disagree with the response below - there are additional dining options. Palomino, Capital Grille, and Bice are all connected to the hotel. A great variety. The spa is amazing! As is the workout facility. The pool is great as well. The rooms may not be the most modern, but they are very nice. And the hotel itself can't be beat for beauty in Dallas. Another treat is the location - right on the trolly line for McKinney Ave - a street lined with shopping, restaurants, bars & art galleries. Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Service”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: I wanted to do something special for our wedding anniversary so I booked a room at the Crescent. The price was steeper than I would normally pay, but being a special occasion, I thought it would be worth it. Unfortunately, that was not the case. I requested that flowers, a fruit basket, and a bottle of champagne be in our room at check in. I was assured that this was not an unusual request (all at my expense), and would be taken care of. When we arrived at the hotel, I asked the front desk if my special requests had been noted in the reservation and was told that nothing special had been noted. Told not to worry, that fresh flowers were placed in every room every day, and that the fruit basket and champagne would be on the way shortly. Needless to say, none of the above materialized. We never did get flowers, not even the ones that are supposedly placed in every room every day. After about two hours I called room service and asked where were the fruit basket and champagne. They delivered a bowl of bananas and apples (yawn), and a bottle of domestic California champagne for over $100 per bottle. I would have happily paid for the items that I requested given the chance. My money and business will go elsewhere when I decide to celebrate a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Very Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: kwins0113
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights during late August. The temperature was 102 both days. Our room was ready early, and we were able to check in by 11:00 AM. Nice & comfortable, with a nice spacious bathroom. The in-room safe did not work and we called down to notify guest services. By the time we returned to the room, after going exploring, the safe had been removed. We went out to dinner and a new safe was in place. Quick and efficient!! Be aware, breakfast is expensive, but very good. If you go at the end of the posted signs, you could get a very overwhelmed server. However, if you arrive when breakfast is just beginning, service is excellent. Valet parking is quick and efficient. Also, if you are staying over a Friday or Saturday night, you will find a lot of traffic coming to the hotel. It looked like NYC gridlock at the valet station, with everyone coming in for their reservations at Nobu, as well as the several private functions going on at the hotel. Although a little out of the way, the hotel does have a dedicated hotel car, which will take you anywhere within a 5 mile radius. We visited the Dallas Art Museum and Nasher Sculpture Garden. Very easy, and when we wanted to return, we just called the driver's cellphone. The spa is great, and very comfortable. Nice massage and a very large exercise area. The lockerooms were not crowded and very clean. All in all, a very romantic location and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad First Impression”
Reviews.Author: KCR9999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the highly touted Hotel Crescent Court for the first time. Even with a corporate rate it was no bargain so I had high expectations. I was disappointed and will not stay there again. Our room smelled musty / smoky and the decor was no better than the Westin I usually stay in. I asked our bellman for ice which never came. I had problems with the DSL and phones - I was not able to get an outside line therefore not able to access the internet. A desperate situation for a business traveler like me. Next time I'll try Hotel Zaza or Hotel St. Germain B&B.
